name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Many of the nurses were unprofessional and to me I felt disrespected. I know for a fact that me a a resident was talked about among the nurses. What started it was a case of y a case of being guilty of association.i heard innuendos  from the. Nurses. insinuating that I would smoke meth..and even if I was.i had no idea to eat high level of judgementality is in the medical field. My last few days here I felt SO uncomfortable and couldn't wait to leave

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I Grandma was mistreated and died due to they're negligence and lack of care of human beings. If you love you family members stay far away.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Do NOT bring your loved one here. Yes, very clean. That is about the only thing they do. If your loved one can't advocate for them selves they will be left there and ignored. You'll never be able to get a case worker, nurse on the phone. Each shift can't tell u what the other shift did or didn't do. They just want your money.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Read the negative reviews and take heed!  Do not let the positive reviews or their little tour fool you. They will send you down a rabbit hole on your care and information about your care.  God forbid you need a CNA, nurse or Social Worker.   You will be ignored. There's so much more to disclose...I could have this placed closed down forever!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Excellent facility. Very clean, excellent food and physical therapists are excellent and insure you’re at your full potential before you are released. Friendly atmosphere, I highly recommend this facility while you are recovering.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Very clean and  family friendly environment.  You can tell the Nursing staff take their job very serious and will give you a comprehensive run down from the start and finish of their patients day

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: This place does not advocate for a speedy recovery. Poor nursing attendants. Few staff is awesome but the bad is awful especially at night when nobody is watching. The 6 days I was here were the longest in my life.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: They have take great care of me with getting my meds and dealing with my cancer, anxiety, and diabetes.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Friendly staff. Good care. I recommend

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: This place is clean, professional, and the employees are very kind. I’d recommend this center!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Therapy is phenomenal, kitchen is alright with food, RN Penny is awesome and has been awesome since day one. Diana G. was a great supporter for me when I really needed her during my time of COVID.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: The facility was super well taken care of and the employees were all helpful and very attentive as well.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: This place is top notch. Thank you for caring for my grandfather.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: La comida es muy buena en la cafetería.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Amazing care facility

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Kayleigh, is amazing to speak with she is always so thoughtful and considerate. So helpful!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Amazing admissions personnel

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Very impressed with this facility. So clean and a really friendly and happy environment.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Best place, best people, best care. It's so clean and tidy and everyone treats you so well. I definitely recommend Arlington Gardens

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: The facility is wonderful and I recommend it to everyone. They treat us so well and if I ever needed to return to a skilled nursing facility I would not go anywhere else but here.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I am here for my second time and I would refuse to go anywhere else for therapy. They all treat me so well and are on top of everything. The nurses and cna's are amazing especially Beatrice and Manny. I would also be lost without my wonderful therapist Connie and Blume and Kayleigh in admissions. She always checks on me and is so accommodating. I recommend this place to everyone

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: The only thing thay I can say is a 5 star wonderful place complete with caring people

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Some of the greatest institutional chefs there is. Care givers are friendliest and very competent at their jobs. They made stay a lot easier to deal with.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Just wanted to say by far this place has been sooo great for my mom.The place is soooo clean and smells always fresh when you walk in. All the staff has been great.  Katie and Kaylee has been soooo amazing and has went out of there way for my mom. Physical therapy has gotten my mom so much stronger.  Thank you all for taking really good care of my mama♥️🙏♥️

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Do you have hi my name is Lynda Midgett. Just want to tell you how great I think Kaylee is. She has helped me so much since I’ve been here. I was crying one day and she came in and talk to me forever. I wouldn’t want to do anything or go any other place but here because of Kaylee Thank you very much.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: My sister almost died here. It was the worst two months. There would be days they wouldn't feed her or give her the medication she needed. Trash that would be on the floor would be there a week later. They had to send her to the hospital due to lack of care. This place physiologically traumatized her. You hear people asking for help while majority of the nurses ignore them. There is not wnough space to qrite They even "lost" her brand new walker. I would HIGHLY advise not to take your family members here.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: My husbands was there for 5 1/2 weeks and they all took such good care of him.  They were available whenever he needed them. They kept us informed about how he was doing. Katie was on top of it with Medicare and Kaleigh made us feel very comfortable whenever I had a question.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text:
There were good and bad things so on the good side.the staff were very nice.and friendly.the drinking water was exceptional!
My one bladder episode was solved by a cna who relieved a very painful bladder that would not empty..I think she saved my life!
On the negative side too few staff in the evenings.and overcrowding in the physical therapy room

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: My mom had a recent 3 month stay here and overall it went very well. The first day we were there we were greeted by the director who was very welcoming and all staff was always friendly. The first thing I noticed was the cleanliness of the place and how it never smelled. That’s a big deal when entering a care facility. The place is well kept. My mom had the beginnings of a bed sore on her lower back from her recent stay at a hospital and when she was transferred to Arlington Gardens they immediately started treatment and  they got it healed within 2 weeks. She also has Parkinson’s and beginnings of dementia and that is a big worry for me because she forgets often. They always kept her safe . Everytime I would pop up at all different times to visit she was always clean and comfortable. From my experience mom’s nurses were great . The person though who really has my heart is Crystal from social services. She went above and beyond not only in helping me to understand my options for care after my mom left with them but she worked really hard to actually follow through and help me transfer her to a long term facility to continue to receive proper care for her needs. She was so personable from day 1 and always got back to any questions I had even though some days she was super busy. She helped me when nobody else did and for that I’m so thankful. People need to remember no care center is perfect. There are all different people from all walks of life with different levels of care needs. Not every day is going to be perfect. If you are able to check in on your family member you should and not place all responsibility on staff. They seem to be doing their best here in my experience and I’d definitely recommend them.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: This place is a joke and even funnier joke is the employees below making reviews about how great it is to work there … I’m sure it is given you all sit around enjoying games of lying to patients and their family members. My grandma has been there for about 4 months and they will move her to different rooms without explanation, change their story 4 times to different family members , ignore calls, took X-rays of my grandma but wouldn’t tell her or her son why and what they x ray showed … among so many other things. The comments about her insurance or lack of money may have something to do with it. My parents have be there (my dad is her son) for two hours l, still there now at 8pm getting the run around why my grandma is in a new room where she doesn’t know where anything is or why and in pain but in the dark about her cray. The employees are also laughing at this entire thing. I can’t wait to laugh when we report this facility.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Very good hospitality

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: a horrible place they ignored my father the whole time and refused to let us move him to a different place until he was forced to go to the hospital due to an infection from the lack of attention causing him to pass away

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Well I always said I would post something about this place but I’m going to be honest and call it like i see it I been here for a good bit trying to get better it’s not all about me well it’s this place that is okay staff is ok cuz there are some good ones that do go out of there way to help you and others that pull double shifts a lot going on here that gets me thinking about here I was mostly negative about stuff here at times and just recently I went through an ordeal that  happens in life that you can’t avoid it is a part of life And now getting through it with people that  are ok and even a social  worker 😎 I wish I can  name them all and much thanks to activities department that kept me busy Thank You Arlington Gardens care center  But I still do think this place needs gardens😁

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I was referred to Arlington Gardens but I was hesitant because of the reviews but let me tell you! This place has Excellent Service!!! Needed full time assistance/recovery for a few weeks due to back surgery and all the staff in there showed professionalism and care not only with me but with visitors especially during this time of COVID they make sure no one comes in without a mask!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I have had a loved one at Arlington for a long time and I highly recommend this facility! The staff is so helpful, the department heads are friendly and great to work with and you can tell the administrator cares deeply about everything that goes on there.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Do not take a loved one to Arlington Gardens.  This place is a nightmare.  My Dad was there for a couple months in early 2022.  While there they let him fall out of a wheelchair, lost his upper dentures and he developed bed sores.  There were some nice employees there, but overall I found them to be rude and dismissive, especially the management.  His room was consistently dirty.  I had to ask them to clean him and his room.   I also found a female patient outside at night sitting in the dark on the patio area that they forgot about.  When I went and told staff, it took them over 10 minutes to go get her.   I turned in a reimbursement form for Dad's lost dentures and it took them three months to issue payment.  I would never, ever recommend this facility to anyone - it was an absolutely bad experience all around.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: So far, so good! My Dad's staying there, and I can see all the reviews on here, all stating mostly positive reviews. I do see some severe negative reviews, mostly accusation of the staff being neglectful and lazy. I can see this place is either..... hated or loved.... there's no in between's. I guess I'm going to have to keep my guard up......to be on the safe side!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text:
My 88 year old Mom was here for several weeks and it was truly a nightmare.  She was there to regain her strength , but she was being fed peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, which I don't consider to be nutritious.  They were so late administering her meds on several occasions that her BP went seriously high.  She called me in a panic and I had to contact the administrator to get her the meds she needed.  One day they were moving her to another part of the facility and they put her in a wheelchair and forgot about her.  She sat in that wheelchair for FOUR HOURS calling for help and finally wheeled herself to find help.

We moved her to a Board and Care where she is now getting the help she needed and she is rapidly improving.  She's gained ten pounds in three weeks, her BP is steady, and her mind is clear.  Arlington Gardens was a huge set back for her and not some place I recommend.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I am currently a patient here and I had Kathy and Jessica as my CNA's on my first night here from the hospital. I was so sick and couldn't keep anything down. They were constantly there for me no matter what and never complained and never made me feel like a burden. They were like my guardian angels. So many people complain and forget to recognize the good things so I just want to give them the recognition that they truly deserve. Thank you for all that you do.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Please do not place your loved ones here. They did not take care of my grand-aunt and as soon as she passed away, they locked my family out of access to her medical records. (Something wasn’t right with her care and we were monitoring the medication and nursing (lack) of care. I regret her being there, if I can spare one family from the hassle and pain of inadequate gross medical malpractice, then this will have been worth it.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I was in Arlington gardens for three weeks. Most of the staff was very friendly and helpful. The physical therapy and occupational therapy is the best in Riverside.   It was kept very clean.  I’m sorry to say no one seems to know how to regulate the heating and air-conditioning, you can be freezing in one room go to another it’s like a sauna. That’s why I can’t give them five stars.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: My dad stayed at Arlington Gardens for about 3 weeks. I have to say it is a very nice place and the staff was just great. Staff always kept me informed of everything.  I have no complaints. Would like to thank the staff for their hard work. Thank you so much!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text:
Terrible customer service.
Most nursing staff sitting at nursing station. On cell phones !
I was not there long (less than 24 hrs)but long enough to know it was not a place I would EVER recommend.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I want to give a huge thank you to the entire Arlington Gardens Care Center staff for all their support and care provided during my stay. The team of medical care workers genuinely had their best interest invested in my recovery. I initially came to Arlington Gardens from Kaiser Hospital, after my surgery. I was basically bed ridden for a couple of months. The physical, occupational,and speech therapy teams at Arlington Gardens are the BEST!! As a team they planned my rehabilitation treatment and every day they worked together to ensure I was meeting my daily goals. They kept me motivated and safely pushed me to meet my goals. Finally, I would like to thank my treating physicians Dr. Tran and Dr. Mistry who both provided top notch care! Having a Kaiser presence at this facility made it easy for them to have direct access to my medical record and be able to keep in constant communication with  my other Kaiser specialists. I highly recommend this facility and I appreciate the high level of care.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text:
My daughter recently spent almost 3 weeks at Arlington Gardens. There just aren't words to say how great this place is. When I first pulled in I enjoyed seeing the trees, beautiful flowers and how clean and well kept. I was greeted inside with a smiling young lady who was very kind and caring. Even though it was after visiting hours, once I finished filling out paperwork, I was allowed to go to her room. As I walked to her room, it was like a luxury hotel with vibrant purple and gold carpet. I was so impressed at how clean everything was. When I got to my daughter's room, she was already settled in bed with a food tray!! She was given a lot of attention from doing therapy, monitoring her vitals, assisting in showers and helping her in the bathroom. She was never alone for too long. They were constantly checking on her to see how she was, if she needed something or just stopping in to say hi! They are so professional and caring. Each and every employee was super friendly and always smiling! I was especially impressed with the fact that the people caring for her were Certified Nursing Assistants. Another Unique concept is the outdoor patio for family visitation. Or a patient can just go out and enjoy fresh air.
If you need to be in a rehab yourself or a loved one, you won't find a better facility.
Also, the food is great!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text:
My wife's Aunt was sent to them from Parkview hospital in Riverside.
The treatment was sub par. They sent her home on hospice. She left Arlington gardens worse of than when she got there. Many mistakes, many.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Thank you to Kristin in the admissions department on assisting my grandmother get placed at the facility. She made the process quick & easy for my family and I. Kristin went above and beyond on making sure my grandmother was comfortable and understand how skilled nursing works. I appreciate the team and most of all I appreciate Kristin for being so kind during this difficult process!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text:
If I could give this place zero stars, I WOULD. I was there for ONE and a half day because I felt super uncomfortable and did not like the place , especially the staff. The staff made me feel unsafe and I felt that I was not going to get the help that I needed. I would use the call light and they would pass right by my room ignoring me and  the needs that I needed in order to feel better. It was so bad that I just wanted to
Leave the following day after I was admitted.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: My dad spent time here after an illness.  The physical therapists are great and my dad made good progress pretty quickly.  The physical therapy is the ONLY reason this place scored more than 1 star.  Unfortunately, the nursing staff is not only overworked and understaffed, it has also made them apathetic.  For 3 days my dad complained about his room being too hot.  I finally called the nursing director and she went to his room and found that the a/c had never even been turned on.  One night my dad rang for help getting to the bathroom and no one showed up until they brought his dinner tray.  My dad told that guy that he needed help (by then he had pooped his bed) and after another 45 minutes of no one showing up, dad called me.  He was finally taken care of after I called and chewed them out.  They screwed up dad's pain medication, they didn't bother to help him with his CPAP machine until 2am....It goes on and on.  Don't send anyone who is completely immobile to this place.  It's dangerous.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Great facility and staff. Very caring.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: My father has been  here 3 days and he has called me and told that the staff is not paying attention to him he has to yell for the nurse to come and when they do they dont come in and check on him they act like they are looking  all they do is walk by the room and ignore him.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I've been a patient here for over the last three months, I've been in several rehab centers but this one is definitely the one. The staff is friendly they make you feel at home especially with Covid19 going on, here they treats you like family, so you're not as alone as you probably would think. This has been an incredible experience I would recommend this facility to anyone that wants to be well taken care of and appreciated, from clean rooms washing your clothes just everything the facility has to offer. The occupational and physical therapy is awesome even though I rather be at home they make you feel like you are at home here. Thank you guys for all that you do for me I really appreciate it.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I have been at Arlington Gardens and it is the only place I would go.  The nursing care is awesome.  The therepy is world class.  The adminstration is very professional.  This is place to be!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: They take forever to answer call light. Or they just clear it secretively without us seeing them so they don’t have to assist us

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: My brother has been there for a week. I’ve called the staff to get an update on my brother, but no one got back to me. I called. I emailed. Not one response. At least my brother had a cell phone. I’m sure they are busy, but what about the family? How do we keep my brother safe?  How is he doing? We could talk to the doctors at the hospital, but not here. Oh well, Kaiser sent him here for rehab. If he needs to go back I will fight to find a place that is patient and family focused. This was like putting him in a haunted house.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Staying at Arlington Gardens has been one of the most pleasurable experiences I’ve had ever have had ever when I have my surgeries I am always come here this is a place that is filled with lots of love understanding and so much caring about their patients yes this is a facility with many people and staff and as we all know it’s usuallyMore residence then staff so they do the best they can and let me tell you their best is the best each and every staff member here deserves 1 million gold stars

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I came to Arlington Gardens for a stroke and little did I know this place would be the biggest blessing. I will never forget the care and friendly faces that I received at Arlington Gardens. In a time when I felt like I had nobody, everyone here made me feel like I was family. Thank you to everyone who played a huge role into my recovery. I am now happy and healthy!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text:
My father was at Arlington Gardens for 2.5 months after being discharged with septic pneumonia, primary focus was physical therapy and occupational therapy for him, as he could do almost nothing for himself after being discharged for the hospital.

He was at another facility for 10 days after his hospital stay, and I did not care for the original facility he was in and it was very far away.  The day I realized he could be transferred I stopped by Arlington Gardens and inquired about openings and was immediately given a tour and I received a call from Amanda in Admissions within a few minutes after leaving.   The Admissions department was amazing.  I was able to get him transferred to Arlington Gardens the same afternoon I first inquired about availability.

I was at this facility A LOT.  I was there at least 2 times daily and sometimes 3 times during my father's stay, so I was able to witness a lot.

The facility is beautiful, clean, smells clean.  The staff are friendly and they didn't seem stressed out or unhappy (unlike the previous facility).   I was greeted each time I entered the facility (during normal hours) at the front desk.

The Physical Therapy and Occupational Therapy departments I feel are really top-notch at this facility.   I saw them go above and beyond with many patients, and my father.  I was allowed to go to therapy with him, and saw how they pushed him to do as much as possible, while being careful for his well-being.

My father was hospitalized twice during his stay, and Amanda in admissions worked closely with me to help ensure he had a room when he was discharged from the hospital.  The transportation service AG used was on-time and pleasant the one time we used that service.

I took my dad to more than one doctor's appointment during his stay, and as long as I let them know in advance, his nurses prepared packets carefully for his appointment, and were very accommodating to make sure we made it safely to our transportation.   Concerns that I addressed with the LVN/Charge nurse were addressed to my satisfaction.

I really appreciate the care that the CNA's, LVN's, RN's, housekeeping, maintenance, and dietary/kitchen, Physical Therapy/Occupational Therapy gave my father during his stay.  As I said, I was there very frequently, and I dealt personally with every department, and they were all always accommodating of our requests.  If another time comes that my dad needs to be facility I will want him to go back to AG.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I am not impressed with Arlington Gardens my mom 83 y/o is currently there , no one answereds call light, when the do it hrs for anyone to come, nights are worse, she is there for rehab I have gotten numerous calls from her crying because no comes, I left a messege for administrator Brent Jessee to call me and never has yet, she has been there 5 days so far it makes it worse because of covid 19 I cant see her

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Thí place Ia convenient. Thanks

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I only give it 5 stars because of 1 night Cna.  I never caught her name but she had black hair,  very young and Hispanic.  She was so gentle and sweet with my father along with his personal caregiver who sat with him at night named Tia P . I would not trade those 2 young ladies for nothing in the world! They made my father's stay more comfortable than anyone else in the facility.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: This is a horrible place!!!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I've been to 4 SNF's previously. Fighting diabetes. This place is leaps and bounds above Corona Health Care, Waterman Canyon, Alta Vista and Parkview. They listen to your needs and try thier hardest to make you comfortable. From dietary, to housekeeping, laundry,, CNA's, Social Services, Nurses, Administration and the doctors. They're all golden in my opinion.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: My dad has been here over 2 weeks and so far so good. The staff seems to all be really kind, caring and up to date on what needs to be done. The only bad thing I have noticed so far is that at night they are WAY under staffed. When I say it takes a while to get someone to come I am talking hours. Every night that my dad or his room mate have needed anything they will push the button at like 2 AM and not get any help until like 4 am. They need more help at night.  Other than that everyone is doing a great job

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: They are a good facility. Most important is they are working on being a great facility. You children: stop being lazy, and volunteer. What is one or two hours? Let's see if yuz old guys can pull off "one last" swan song, go get those corporate sponsors for your new free parties. But even that won't change morons who are mad all the time or mean, and at this stage in life, What are you going to do?, Out them in the same room and lock the door?

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I was able to tour this facility over the weekend and was warmly greeting by the receptionist who showed me around. This facility truly impresses and I would highly recommend everyone give it a tour if you and your loved ones need a nice place to get rehab.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text:
My mother has a stay at Arlington Gardens recently.  The caregivers were nice and easy to work with and we as a family were hands in and had a lot of demands.  For the most part they met the demands. However on my mother's discharge day Arlington Gardens messed up big time. I came to the facility the night before her discharge to finish cleaning out her room and recap the next day plans which my mother has a very important doctor's appointment which took months to get. When the transportation arrived she wasn't ready she was still in bed wet and undressed, well they dress her horribly and sent her out in the poring rain, she was late for the doctor's appointment and they would not take her.

After my investigation I was told by a day Change nurse that know one knew she was leaving.  The facility doesn't have follow through.  My mother's appointment got set by several weeks and I had to beg her physician to give us a 30 day supply of medicine all because of the discharge error. We will not use this facility again.

Good luck families.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: My mother-in-law has received great care at AG. She is very frail. They are very gentle and attentive. The rooms are spacious, and the facility is well laid out. The staff members are very kind. They are patient when she struggles to communicate. They listen to her preferences. If she is napping when her food is delivered, they offer to heat it up for her when she wakes up. I was very impressed by the cleanliness of the facility.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text:
Im 56 and I stayed here for 2 weeks. I expected a smelly,  place with people wandering the halls unattended. I was pleasantly surprised.  Apparently, there are two wings, one is short term the other was for longer stays. I stayed in the short term wing.
Although the CNAs were sometimes understandably distracted and forgot things at times, they were always upbeat, caring, gentle and listened.  My call button was always answered in a timely manner. I never had an accident or sat in soiled sheets.  The bed was comfortable.  We were bathed twice a week and had access to soap, toothpaste,
mouthwash,  washclothes and towels.  You have the choice of having your family or the facility doing your laundry. Dr. Mistery (spelling?) came by at least once a day, sometimes more often.  He always greeted me in the hallway and didn't seem to mind when I occasionally stopped him to ask him questions about my care. He was caring and stayed to answer as many questions as I had and made sure I understood my care plan.   There was a place in the facility to get your haircut. There were daily activities available like bingo, crafts, magazines, group talk, religious activities, etc.  You have a choice whether to participate or not. There were lemonade, water, tea, punch and crackers available in the recreation room/cafeteria all day. You had the choice of eating in your room or in the cafeteria.  You could have guests in your room,  in little seating areas inside (equipped with tv which you can control),  in the rec room/cafeteria or at tables outside. The therapy people were great, they explained my treatments and answered all my questions.  I got both physical and occupational therapy each day, 5-6 times a week. As I said,  overall,  I was impressed with Arlington Gardens and wouldn't hesitate to put my mother there,  based on my stay.  I held back one star only because of a laundry mishap I had on one occasion.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: This place is not good! Please make sure your loved one is cared for right. My grandma lasted there 2 days! My mom had to stay there for the two nights to make sure my grandma was taken care of but she was not, a member staff almost dropped my grandma and then almost hit her in the face with the bed rails WHILE MY MOTHER WAS THERE, they would not warm up my grandmas milk because "it was not allowed" they told my mom that she could not stay in the room and then a staff member told my mom to not interrupt and then they told her that they could not care for my grandma because she was  "too needy" I understand that every patient has different level of care but warming up milk, helping a patient to the bathroom... that is what a facility is getting paid for. It wasnt until my mom and aunt decided to take her out of the facility that everyone started apologizing and saying that they didnt know that my mom could stay there and they were sorry oh and once they realized that they had made up their mind on taking my grandma home they added "WELL YOU CANT TAKE ANY OF THE DME" my only thought on this is "seriously???? That is the least important thing in this situation especially because we have all the dme needed in the house. That is what it takes for people to be considerate for the POAs to get angry. That is thir job and they are getting paid to do so if they dont not enjoy it maybe people should choose a diferent field but to not treat somebody right and not give them the care that was promised it is so frustrating.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Rehab patients share rooms with patients who need nursing  care. Two entirely different needs. The food is terrible.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text:
Very disappointed with this place. My dad had a hip replacement. We were referred here and did the tour. Due to his type of insurance we were told he would have his own room, which he did get. We were also told that the food was all homemade as my dad tends to be a picky eater. While visiting him, he was given a baked potatoe and meat that was hard as a rock. We ended up bringing him his own food. Also, my dad experienced a lot of pain after PT. The nursing staff requested an X-ray to be done out of fear his hip was out of the socket. The X-ray came back normal but the pain continued. His mental state was not the same. He was experiencing confusion. I told the nurse and she said she was going to request a UTI test but didn't happen. After a week of continued confusion, he was sent to the hospital to get more tests done. Within 8 hours of being in the hospital, it was confirmed that his hip was out of the socket and he had both a blood infection and a UTI which may be contributing to the confusion.

When he called the staff to help him use the restroom, he waited up to 45 min before they helped. Being too late he had multiple accidents. From the families perspective, he was poorly taken care of.

The PT and OT staff seemed to be the only ones helpful!!! Thank them for that. Thankfully he is at the hospital and will not be returning there when he needs to go back to rehab.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I still don’t knw til the day since September 22 2017 why NO ONE from this facility still hasn’t contact my family to tell us that they knew my mom would be passing away we are not dr they are train to know and it’s 2018 now n no one Britt has not called n said anything I think it was really sad how we was treated there I  not every patient that come there doesn’t have family we love out mom y’all took away her last moment by not calling to tell us that time was near . God have mercy on your souls so wrong we never got a care team meeting n was here for  a month they made my mom died faster

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: My mom was very disatisfied with her care here post hip replacement. Inadequate food, slow and inattentive response from staff. She felt neglected. I am sad to post this review.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I have arrived to Arlington Gardens care center around 5:30pm on Tuesday June 13,17 with private Ambulance Assistant  when they drop me off there was no one in the front desk to help us finally we found someone the women was very rude & did not give us any greeting @ all, they went ahead & gave me a room # us soon as they drop me off to my  room that I was assigned to. Private  Ambulance Assistant ask them to turn on A/C  do to that I was not feeling well. The room  was very hot. One of the Nurse which was a male ask, maintenance to turn it on. So I was waiting patiently for someone to know that I was here & to at least get a greeting & let me know that they were my nurse or something. I continue on waited for 1hr.& 20min., I kept ringing the nurse bell like 5 times,No one came. Until the same male nurse came by my door & Assistant another patient. And I ask him if anybody was going to Assistant me & turn on the A/C because it was hot his response was that he was very busy. I told them that I been sitting in this room for an 1hr.& 20min. With no Assistant he was very unprofessional. And said to hold on so I waited longer well to get to my point the A/C was never turn on , my medication was not order on time he had to give me someone else if anything.Because I was in pain. My nexts pill was @ 1:00 am. Other nurse that was here do to other leavening and my medication still did not arrive. He tried on given me Tylenol which I said no.I needed  my other pills to relaxes my nerves & for my swollen to go down from my  leg do to my broken knee. So the gave me same thing they gave me last night which that only help like for 4 hrs. Which I'm still in pain, and will get my medications @ 9:00 am. Which I'm very disappointed because I missed my two pills that I need to take Do to my pain. It is 7:00 am Wednesday 14, 17 & no one has came to tell me any thing about the facility policy.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: This Is Such A Great Place ! My Family & I Went Yesterday  Too See My Grandma Evelyn Berenice Williams & All I Could Say Was It's Beautiful 💕 The Fact That Everyone Greeted Us With Respect As Soon As We Walked In Was Great ! My Grandmas Nurses Were Sweet & Kind Young Ladies 😊 Arlington Gardens Care Is A Beautiful Place Inside & Out 😊 Thank You For Taking Good Care Of My Grandma !

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text:
Our experience has been horrible as I have a dear friend that is in there for hospice care.  First they kept giving her food she wouldn't and couldn't eat, whenever she pushed her button it took a long time for anyone to come and help her, after two weeks she is having a hard time swallowing.  We had a "care meeting" and her diet was changed but they still brought the wrong diet.  We all started bringing food in that we knew she liked.  Though she didn't eat much it was satisfying knowing she enjoyed what she had.  I was there this past Monday and noticed a lot of junk in her mouth so I got her toothbrush and used a washcloth and brought out a lot of undigested and gross looking food.  I then wiped it out again with a cold washcloth which she just wanted to suck on as her mouth and lips were dry.  To make a long story short hospice came in Wednesday and found that they had not been giving her the medicine they prescribed because one of the nurses was unsure how to measure it.  Really, a licensed nurse was uncomfortable giving a patient medication expressly prescribed by hospice.  This hospice worker also cleaned this patients mouth out again on Wednesday and it was full of junk again.
I have already filed a grievance, contacted another service who will be coming to investigate and am reporting them to the Better Business Bureau.  How they get a rating of a five through Medicaid is beyond me.  I was generous in giving a 2 rating as their are three CNA's and two RN's that appear very caring.  I would rather have a plain looking building with much better service then some gorgeous building where Case Management is always in meetings and you have to hunt down staff to care for your loved ones. Please don't let the aesthetics of the building fool you, you will regret your loved one being there and this isn't just my opinion.  There will be more opinions on here soon from another patients family.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: My mom just had a knee replacement. She was supposed to be there for the rehabilitation. But I noticed my Mom's behavior started to change. Now my mom is paranoid and confused. In addition, she fell out of her hospital bed but didn't get transfer to a hospital for observation until two hours later. And she was transferred to the wrong hospital. Due to the emotional distress I had her transferred to palm terrace and hopefully they will do a better job caring for my mother. Arlington Gardens is extremely understaff at night. And the craziest thing about it no one from their administrator staff apologize.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: This is an excellent facility. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The food was good and the salads were especially tasty & refreshing. The physical therapy department was a tremendous help to me & the team is extremely competent. They took care of me at Arlington Gardens and for that, I will always be greatful.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text:
I'm really sad Arlington Gardeb Care has bad reviews. Approximately, 2 yrs ago my father suffered from 2 open heart surgeries a week apart from one another. At the advise of the hospital we took him to another facility near his home. That place looked like an insane asylum...
There were several unattended mentally unstable seniors wondering the hallways alone. Some were crying profusely and others seemed to be delusional and lost. The first 24 hours there we stayed with my father and tried to look past what we saw. Until, a nurse walked in without washing her hands and had no gloves preparing to check my fathers fresh chest incision. I quickly got on the phone and did my due diligence. I asked this other horrible rehab center release my father.
We took dad to Arlington senior Care. We couldn't be happier. Everyone was very attentive and the entire hospital was very clean! Everything was conveniently in the hospital like physical therapy and doctor on call visits. They nursed him back to health in about 3 weeks. If I didn't experience the horrendous care center before I probably would have never had a full appreciation of this one. Thank you again for taking care of my father Arlington senior care center!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I'm writing this review from Millington, TN. I am Writing to plead with the CNA's and RN. Please look after my grandmother ELMA DIXON. I am to far to come and take her home and care for her myself. If i could I honestly would. But it looks like it's up to you all. I am very uncomfortable reading some of the reviews and i'm unable to provide a review based on an experience, but i can write a review based on hope! I hope you all love my grandmother and treat her like she is your own. She is a wonderful woman who deserves the best care possible. I know that most patients and their families think that but i am hear to tell you.. You all have the luxury of caring for a POWERFUL GOD FEARING WOMAN!!!! My MAMAW!!! Please care for her and send her home!!! Send her home ASAP!!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: We placed mom here after her massive stroke on June 11, 2016.  This place looks beautiful and has their 5 stars on the walls, but don't let that fool you. BEWARE! They only have ONE RN on duty for the entire facility, they have a 26 to one ratio for LVN's. There is a revolving door of CNA's.  So....one night I called to check on my mom at 3am......waitied 20 mins for someone to answer the front desk phone.  The LVN told me she was "one her belly" and sleeping comfortably. MOM HAS NO LEFT SIDE MOBILITY FROM HER STROKE!  Found out the next morning he got my mom mixed up with the patient next to her, but worse yet, mom's sleeping pill meds were not given to her, they were given to the patient next to her!!   Dealing with the nurses up at the front desk is a nightmare.....on one occasion, while trying to get info about why they called me to tell me moms blood pressure had jumped sky high, we stood there for 20 mins while the "Doctor" (if you could call her that) and the LVN, argued back and forth about why mom computer data wasn't updated with this very important information and therefor the "Doctor" couldn't do anything for my mom.  When I got angry about this, one of the other nurses went over to the LVN and patted her on the back as said "do you need chocolate" in a sarcastic voice and then flipped her hair and said "I need a break, I can't take this anymore".  So unprofessional.  About this time someone came running up to the desk to say mom was having chest pains......what a BLESSING IN DISGUISE!  We got her out of there and after a short stay at Kaiser, we placed her at AFVW.  Best thing we ever did!  She is getting much better and the staff their are very caring and family friendly.  They really listen to your concerns and DO something about them!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text:
While looking for a potential place for my dad we thought we'd drop in for a tour. We walked through the doors to find an empty front desk and women in an office chit chatting about their manicurist.  We proceeded through the ENTIRE facility and was never once asked if we needed any help.
The hallways were busy and at times conjested and cramped. (And had a weird odor)  There were several unattended call lights and the majority of the paitents were in bed, slumped over.
After walking around for over 15 mins we made it back to the front desk and asked for the actual tour.
I was heartbroken to hear during the tour that the old, run down, building directly next to the main building was actually the long term care center. It had tarps covering the roof, old swamp coolers in windows with dirty rusted window panes... the long term "patio" area had become the employees "designated smoke area" only 5 feet from their back door.
Walked out of there feeling bad for their current residents.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: I stayed here for a month about 3 years ago. I was VERY well taken care of and I loved the way the staff made me feel always welcome and like family. Yes.. there were a couple of bad apples, but they don't and won't last long in a facility that actually cares about its responsibility to the care and well being of its patients.

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Gorgeous facility... warm and welcoming!

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: Durning my stay at Arlington Gardrens I have found the staff to be exceptionally friendly and helpful, willing to meet the needs of the Individual patient. Rooms  are clean and well maintained, the nurses were knowledgeable and took an Intrest In my concerns. 5 STAR

name: Arlington Gardens Care Center
review_text: This is a new facility located in Riverside, CA.  The focus of Arlington Gardens is an individualized approach to recovery. This facility is world class and this is because of the amazing staff at Arlington Gardens.  From its 31 Private Suites to its beautiful decor.  Come experience Arlington Gardens Care Center today!
